# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Sure! Here is a possible implementation of the `clean_column` function in Julia:
```
function clean_column(col)
    col = lowercase(col) # lowercase the column name
    col = trim(col) # remove leading and trailing spaces
    col = replace(col, " \\* ".++) # replace any spaces or hyphens with an underscore
    return col # return the cleaned column name
end
```
Note that in Julia, we use the `lowercase` function to convert the column name to lowercase, and the `trim` function to remove leading and trailing spaces. The `replace` function is used to replace any occurrences of the spaces or hyphens with an underscore.
